**ENTRY REQUIREMENTS FOR POSTGRADUATE PROGRAM**
-----------------------------------------------

Get the summarized version [HERE](https://fke.utm.my/wp-content/uploads/2023/08/Kertas-Kerja-Pindaan-Syarat-Kemasukan-v2_page-0007.jpg)
.

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| #### **Postgraduate Program Taught Course Program (MKEH, MEEM, MEEP, MKET)** |     |
| The admission requirements for students entering the Taught Course program are as follows: |     |
| i   | Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or its equivalent recognized by the University Senate (accredited program by the EAC body) with a CGPA ≥ 2.50 / 4.00 or CGPA < 2.50 / 4.00 with a minimum of 5 years of work experience in the relevant field; or |
| ii  | Bachelor’s degree in Engineering other than Electrical Engineering (e.g., Mechanical Engineering, Aeronautical Engineering, Civil Engineering, etc.) or its equivalent with a minimum CGPA ≥ 3.00 / 4.00 and 2 years of work experience in the field of electrical engineering; or |
| iii | Bachelor’s degree in Science (Physics) or its equivalent with a minimum CGPA ≥ 3.00 / 4.00; or |
| iv  | Bachelor’s degree in Science (Computer Science, Software, Information Technology) or its equivalent with a minimum CGPA ≥ 3.00 / 4.00 and 2 years of work experience in the field of electrical engineering; or |
| v   | Bachelor’s degree in Engineering Technology (specifically in the field of electrical engineering) or its equivalent with a minimum CGPA ≥ 3.00 / 4.00; or |
| vi  | Other qualifications approved by the Faculty’s Academic Committee. |
| Candidates who meet the requirements of (ii – vi) are required to take and pass the prerequisite courses determined by the Faculty with a minimum grade of (B-). |     |

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| #### **Postgraduate Research Program, Master of Philosophy** |     |
| The admission requirements for students entering the research program are as follows: |     |
| i   | Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or its equivalent recognized by the University Senate with a CGPA >= 2.75 / 4.00 or 2.50 <= CGPA < 2.75 / 4.00, subject to thorough internal assessment, or CGPA < 2.50 / 4.00 along with at least 5 years of work experience; or |
| ii  | Bachelor’s degree in Engineering other than Electrical Engineering (e.g., Mechanical Engineering, Aeronautical Engineering, Civil Engineering) or its equivalent with a minimum CGPA of 3.30 and 2 years of work experience in the field of electrical engineering; or |
| iii | Bachelor’s degree in Science (Physics) or its equivalent with a minimum CGPA of 3.30; or |
| iv  | Bachelor’s degree in Science (Computer Science, Software, Information Technology) or its equivalent with a minimum CGPA of 3.30 and 2 years of work experience in the field of electrical engineering; or |
| v   | Bachelor’s degree in Engineering Technology (electrical engineering specialization only) or equivalent with a minimum CGPA of 3.30. |
| vi  | Or other qualifications approved by the Faculty’s Academic Committee. |
| Candidates who meet the admission requirements (ii – vi), must enroll in and pass the prerequisite courses determined by the Faculty with a minimum grade of (B-). |     |

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| #### **Fast-Track Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) Postgraduate Research Program** |     |
| The admission requirements for students entering the Fast-Track Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) Postgraduate Research Program are as follows: |     |
| i   | Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or its equivalent from UTM with a CGPA >= 3.67 / 4.00; or |
| ii  | Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent from another recognized research university, as determined by the University Senate, with a CGPA >= 3.67 / 4.00, subject to thorough internal assessment. |

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| #### **Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) Postgraduate Research Program** |     |
| The admission requirements for students entering the Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) research program are as follows: |     |
| i   | Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Electrical Engineering discipline, from UTM or its equivalent from other recognized higher education institutions, as determined by the University Senate. |
